column2: ARIZONA DMV PRACTICE TEST
column4: Arizona
column6: AZ

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. A driver who approaches an intersection:
column4: must yield the right-of-way to traffic already in the intersection.
column6: has the right-of-way over traffic already in the intersection.
column8: must drive straight through the intersection, even if another vehicle is already in the intersection.

column2: 2. Service signs are ____ with ____ letters and symbols.
column4: white; black
column6: green; white
column8: blue; white

column2: 3. If a vehicle suddenly cuts in front of you creating a hazard, which of these actions should you take first?
column4: Sound your horn and step on the brake firmly.
column6: Swerve into the lane next to you.
column8: Take your foot off the gas pedal.

column2: 4. You want to turn left at an intersection ahead. A car reaches the intersection from the opposite direction and moves straight ahead. You:
column4: may not enter the intersection to prepare for your left turn if the light is green.
column6: must wait for the car to go through before you turn.
column8: can turn left. You have the right of way.

column2: 5. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, you must:
column4: move into the right lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
column6: move into the right lane, or to the right side of a single lane.
column8: move into the left lane, or to the left side of a single lane.

column2: 6. After parking, are you allowed to open a door on the road side of your vehicle?
column4: No, never.
column6: Yes, but only if it does not interfere with bicyclists and other traffic.
column8: Yes, always.

column2: 7. This sign means:
column4: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.
column6: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.
column8: Roundabout ahead. Slow down.

column2: 8. Which signs have black letters on a white background?
column4: Guide signs (horizontal rectangle)
column6: Regulatory signs (vertical rectangle)
column8: Warning signs (diamond)

column2: 9. Drivers may need more space in front of their vehicle:
column4: when carrying a heavy load or pulling a trailer.
column6: when following motorcycles.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 10. In case of skidding, drivers should NOT:
column4: tap the gas pedal with their foot.
column6: take their foot off the gas pedal.
column8: pump the brakes gently if they are about to hit something.

column2: 11. Drivers should check their rearview mirrors:
column4: often to see how traffic is moving behind them.
column6: only when slowing down.
column8: to see if a truck is in their blind spot.

column2: 12. Alcohol:
column4: improves your reaction time.
column6: makes you less aware of what is happening to your driving abilities.
column8: makes it easier to make correct decisions.

column2: 13. When driving through a construction zone, drivers should:
column4: come to a complete stop and watch for a flagger.
column6: proceed carefully.
column8: decrease their following distance.

column2: 14. This sign means:
column4: No passing zone ahead.
column6: Do not to enter if your vehicle is taller than the height listed on the sign.
column8: Narrow bridge ahead. Slow down and drive with caution.

column2: 15. To avoid glare from headlights of an approaching car:
column4: don't look directly into the oncoming headlights, look toward the right edge of your lane.
column6: stay focused on the center line on the road.
column8: flash your high beams.

column2: 16. What is the purpose of minimum speed limits?
column4: To keep a smooth traffic flow.
column6: To allow emergency vehicles with red flashing lights to safely pass other vehicles.
column8: To halt the traffic flow.

column2: 17. This road sign means:
column4: Merge right
column6: Stop sign ahead
column8: Reduction in lanes

column2: 18. What should you do if one of your tires blows out?
column4: Hold the steering wheel tight and slowly take your foot off the gas pedal.
column6: Leave the road immediately.
column8: Hold the steering wheel tight and brake immediately to avoid the risk of skidding.

column2: 19. You hear a siren close by but can not see where the emergency vehicle is. What do you do?
column4: Pull over to the right side of the road and stop until you are sure the emergency vehicle is not headed toward you.
column6: Keep driving until you are sure the emergency vehicle is headed toward you.
column8: Stop immediately and activate your emergency flashers.

column2: 20. This road sign means:
column4: No Passing Zone
column6: Yield the right-of-way
column8: You have the right of way

column2: 21. A four-way stop sign means:
column4: traffic from all four directions must stop.
column6: if two vehicles reach the intersection at the same time, the driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 22. Slowing down just to look at collisions or anything else out of ordinary:
column4: helps prevent rear-end collisions.
column6: causes traffic congestion.
column8: improves traffic flow.

column2: 23. The ‘Slower Traffic Keep Right’ sign is used:
column4: on multiple lane highways.
column6: at most intersections.
column8: in school zones.

column2: 24. What should you do as you prepare to turn right at an intersection?
column4: Honk your horn.
column6: Signal your turn, check for bicyclists, and do not turn directly in front of a bicyclist.
column8: Yield to bicyclists coming from the opposite direction.

column2: 25. What do flashing red lights on a school bus indicate?
column4: The bus is stopped to load or discharge passengers.
column6: The bus is about to stop.
column8: Traffic that approaches from either direction may proceed.

column2: 26. Pentagonal signs are used to indicate:
column4: school crossings.
column6: possible hazards on roadways.
column8: no passing zones.

column2: 27. If you encounter a severe dust storm:
column4: Increase your speed and try to reach your destination as soon as possible.
column6: Turn on your headlights and continue driving.
column8: Reduce your speed, pull to the side off the road and stop, turn off your lights and take your foot of the brake.

column2: 28. Always stop before you cross railroad tracks when:
column4: you are following a bicyclist or motorcyclist across railroad tracks.
column6: you don't have room on the other side to completely cross the tracks.
column8: you are not wearing safety belts.

column2: 29. What should you do in case of a steering failure?
column4: Pump your gas pedal a few times to increase the pressure.
column6: Leave the road immediately.
column8: Don't panic. Turn on your emergency lights to let other drivers know you are having car problems. Move toward the side of the road and bring the car to a gradual stop.

column2: 30. This sign means:
column4: The road will curve to the right, then to the left.
column6: Road slippery when wet. Drive slowly.
column8: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
